unnormalised: Delhi is seeing a surge in cases of dengue fever, esp. amongst kids, doctors at AIIMS are saying. Hospitals like Max Healthcare are reporting a 20% increase in admissions compared to last month. Apparently, the unseasonal rains have led to more breeding grounds for mosquitoes.
normalised: Delhi is seeing a surge in cases of dengue fever, especially amongst kids, doctors at A-I-I-M-S are saying. Hospitals like Max Healthcare are reporting a twenty percent increase in admissions compared to last month. Apparently, the unseasonal rains have led to more breeding grounds for mosquitoes.

unnormalised: Health officials are advising people to take precautions, like using mosquito repellent and wearing full-sleeved clothes, esp during the day. Dr. Sharma from the Delhi Health Department said, "We're distributing pamphlets with info on prevention. Also, pls don't let water accumulate in pots or tyres – that's where these buggers breed!"
normalised: Health officials are advising people to take precautions, like using mosquito repellent and wearing full-sleeved clothes, especially during the day. Doctor Sharma from the Delhi Health Department said, "We are distributing pamphlets with info on prevention. Also, please don't let water accumulate in pots or tyres – that's where these buggers breed!"

unnormalised: Symptoms to watch out for include high fever (102-104°F), severe headache, and joint pain. If you notice any of these, get yourself checked by a doc ASAP. The helpline number is 1075 for any dengue-related queries. Remember, prevention is always better than cure, bhai!
normalised: Symptoms to watch out for include high fever (one hundred and two to one hundred and four degree Fahrenheit), severe headache, and joint pain. If you notice any of these, get yourself checked by a doc A-S-A-P. The helpline number is one zero seven five for any dengue-related queries. Remember, prevention is always better than cure, bhai!
